text:
Thanks for teaching me Phy103, that was of no helpüòÇ. It was going out for movies with you guys and managing Fresher's night with(without) you!
Although our friendship was not a roller coaster ride since I was absent most of the time, but.. I did went on my first roller coaster ride with you!
Also, are you still in touch with Ruby?
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo, probably the first thing we did together was hanging out with the club(not in FMC room, but in Roorkee). You've helped me a lot in econometrics, sending me the whole answer key at once. In the last few days, I've bumped into you a lot more frequently outside GH or at OAT, all what we did then was just a smile and a hand wave. Other times, we were just waiting for mails from Vedanta. I'm forward to more interactions with you.
I'm glad that I'll have someone with me in the upcoming new chapter whom I already know! Hope to know you better in the future!
See you soon!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Just accept that you started "TT busty" üòÇ!
Also, playing Mafia with you guys was fun!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Thanks for coming to the teacher's day video shoot with me. If I were a real teacher, you would have definitely been my favourite student. It was fun going to the movies together and hanging out with you guys!
See you again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
I have so many memories with you, I think about one and it leads to another and then I get lost thinking about all our moments together. I wish that I could go back to that time again when we first met and I could experience the whole thing again. Lol, this time I'll be brave enough to scare the lizard by myself! Also, this time we'll study PHY103 regularly and not panic the night before the exam. 
I remember how pure you were when you came to IITK and then I started spoiling you right from the first week. Are you still taking the 'khuragh'?
I'll miss those wall paintings, getting ready together, setting up Avisha with guys in our imagination and making her eat soil!
You were like the Mom ( or should say Monica Geller ) of A-602, always doing the right thing, being the cleanest and taking care of two spoiled girls.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo Ganith! Teaching you CHE stuff was fun. I remember how you were panicking before the che352 lab exam and then we went through all the Aspen assignments from the scratch. Man, that was too much work! 
Thanks for waking me up for all the Kaistha's classes and the CHE COM classes. I'm able to complete my degree in time because you woke me up for those classes!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Thanks a lot for making my journey in our department so much easier. You've been a really good tutor explaining to me all the stupid concepts of CHE a night before the exams. I'm glad that we met!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Thanks for introducing me to Peter! 
How were you able to meditate between people making snowman and clicking photographs? Manali trip was fun with you. Also, you're definitely more humorous than Nitik!
Do you remember the "secret admirer" note we wrote for Inshu and then we found it on her soft board? I should have met you sooner!
Let's start playing Among us again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Chandra chaabi de na, FMC room se photos nikal ke Antaragiiiiini exhibition lagani he!!
Also, uss IITR wale Mafia game me detective me thi naaki tu, accept it!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
We first met during Fresher's but you were so quiet and we barely talked. I think I probably heard you talking when we all started studying in CC. Most of the times of going out of the campus in the first two years were with you guys. Probably the first one was the Udghosh Marathon we went to cover at Green Park. I still remember that day. It was the begging of our journey in Udghosh.
Also, thanks for helping us with the photoshoots!
All the best for your future and hope to hang out with you guys in the future too!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
You are shy???
You're in constant touch with Viktor Frankl, how can you still be shy! 
Even the last time we talked at Rave Moti, I don't remember speaking much. You had so much to say, and I enjoyed listening to you. I wish that I could experience everything that you told me with you. If I were a real Spellman, I'd make this happen.
Remember how we used to talk through the notebook during the class? Thank you for pushing me one step closer to identifying the meaning of my life.
Also, thanks for doing my part of the project too. You didn't have to do that, I was already impressed üòú.
Hope to see you again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Bro please let your hairs be my prop again. Iss baar ache se fresh flowers lagaungi‚ù§Ô∏è.
Also, remember the pee on the way to The Mill?
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo Jameendaar! I'll never forget that photo story we did together. I probably got to know you well in the inter-IIT only. And it's one of my best memories at IITK. 
Also, Dolly ka itna bura haal kese hua?
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Shukla Ji, thanks for teaching me all the CHE stuff and making such great class notes. Your notes are a gem just like you!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo! I should not say it here, but it was fun to watch you dancing out of the bathroom in a towel in your wing. Sorry, I couldn't resist writing it in your yearbook.
I'm glad that I have you as my friend, I feel too good and stress-free after talking to you. Thanks for being in constant touch with me during the difficult times. We'll keep it constant in the future too!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Avisha, you're the show stopper for the yearbook too! I saw my first earthworm on our first night out together of IITK. You're my best friend since the day we opened up in the hall4 canteen talking about our experiences. I feel so much comfortable with you that I have told you almost every secret.
I want to dance with you guys again on "unchi hai building" and make you eat more creative cakes!
Love you forever!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
"Hello Poota, Maken hall me he kya? Usse bol na FMC room aaye, call hi nahi utha raha vo!!"
Roorkee and Banaras wouldn't have been fun without you guys! Also, seeing you always reminds me of your "Love" photo with Ankit Meel. Why is that photo not on your yearbook?
Let's do the profile pic twinning again some time!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
"Umm srryüò£üò£"
I don't think you'll ever forget this text nowüòÇ
I'm glad to see you "speaking" now!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
I still have your contact saved as "Undertaker". Thanks for the portrait and that bitching about some CHE peeps. I hope that now you appreciate the perfectness of my nose moreüòõ.
Also, "Oo stree, aana!"
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Hey Captain! Sorry for leaving the team. For the little time I was in the team, I enjoyed a lot only because of you. You pushed me to come to all the treats with you and socialise with the team members. You introduced me to the people who'll be my friends for life just like you. You are a really good friend, and IMO the best captain. You were the initial motivation for me to get out of my shell and do something notable. I wish that I could be there for you as much as you were there for me. Thank you for everything!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Yo! We finally made the door opener, be it for a garage or a barrage. I had fun distributing all the work to other group members and doing the negligible work with you. Thanks for introducing me to the "you're a wizard Harry" video and reviving the "chithi chithi Robot" song a night before the scariest exam of my life. Now that I'm looking back at our moments together, I feel like we were together in so many moments at IITK ( TA group, surge, eng123, philosophy, cult meet, and many more courses) and I never realised that we spent a lot of time together. The coincidences of the "coincidental trio" never actually stopped. Looking forward to more such coincidences!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Our friendship has been like a sine curve. But what's a Manali trip without drama?
Do you remember the motivational note you wrote on a piece of paper that is probably still sticking to the wall of A-601? Everything eventually turned out to be what you wrote there.
Thanks for the 'A' in lif101! Also, I never actually believed the Peter Please thing, I was trying to be safe... Just in caseü§∑!
Also, thanks for making my room the all-time ghost-calling spot! (Even though we failed Ouija board prank badly)
Sorry that you had to live with Baby Yoda's pee in your room.
Allow me to spill beer on your *things* again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Hey Harley Quinn, 
I really enjoyed the last days at IITK with you and if we meet again, I'd love to see you mimicking those voices again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Happy to see that your bio is ":)" and not ":'("
Thoda kam roya kar yaar.
I've seen you excelling in all your academics and still crying on them throughout the four years.
I hope that someday we'll laugh together talking about the che COM classes and the "harassment" thing related to it.
See you again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
I clearly remember the photoshoot, that was the start of bonding with Gh peeps.
I came to your room once in 2nd year to fetch Apurva's kurta. Man, that was a horrible experience üòÇ. I hope that you keep you future rooms clean üòõ.
All the best for your future!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Yo! We finally made the door opener. Although most of the work was done by the TA. I remember how disappointed you were with us for not doing the report work timely. I'm glad that we were in the same group. It was fun doing that lab with you!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Hey brother!
Do you remember advising me to do my homework regularly in Reso? I did follow your advice for some time, and then we came to IITK and I never did my homework by myself again.
You were so serious in Reso, me and Disha Bhatia we're too scared of sitting with you. Then we met on the Audi stage and that was a completely different you! You are as cool as you are hard-working.
All the best for your future and I hope to see you with your clothes inside out again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
You're a wizard Manisha!
What kind of magic did you use to become the sweetest person in the world?
There are only a few people who can make me talk about my problems and you are one of them. You should note it down under your big achievements list. Thank you for listening to me, supporting me and decorating my bed with so many rose petals and toffees! No other roommate could have been so artistic with my bed.
I'll always be here to listen to you and support you and make you cook something for me. I hope all of your problems vanish and you have a great life ahead.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Got to bond with you in the last few months of IITK only. It was fun to make those bum prints on the wall. You are a really good choreographer, you made that weird leg kicking step look so easy.
Why didn't we met sooner??????
Let's continue the drunk talk we started on the terrace!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Naman Roshan, you can never be trusted for taking care of a person in a bad hangover. You can also not be trusted for taking good photographs. But you can be trusted for being a good friend! You always came to hang out with me whenever I called you. You were always there, never too busy for me, and never ghosted me. Also, if I have played TT 100 times, then the 99 times was with you. I love to make fun of you, but you should know that I'll never intentionally hurt you. Also, you should know that you're one of my best friends. Will meet you soon!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Hey Jug,
If I could start over these four years again, the only thing I'll change is to meet you sooner. Right from the first day of orientation, I'll get two seats closer to you. Then, we could have had more trips to jail and a hell lot of Friday nights. You turned me from a beast to a princess without me capturing you into my Castle. You're the most selfless, loving, caring and warmest ( literally warmer than our hot water bag) guy I've met. Still, I had my chilliest kiss with you. It will always come to my mind whenever I'll smell snow. Even your roses never had the thorns but only the sweetest fragrance of blueberries. Thank you for all the beautiful moments you curated for me, for being so selfless and loving, and for being in my life forever.
This is the end of my college but not the end of us. I'm never letting you get away from me.
Yours,
Betty.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
I remember we had to make a group for TRC's course. I showed the list of the students enrolled in the course to Nitik and asked him to recommend someone. He recommended you, saying that you're too hardworking (no doubt about it). Hence, I asked you out for the group and I'm so glad that we did it together. Our group meetings were more of a laughter session! 
I had no contribution to the project except finding the book and calling the meetings, my write-up work was done by the "senior member" of our group himself. 
I really enjoyed making fun of TRC's habits for the first "off" of the course with you guys! I hope that you achieve the highest level of happiness in your life and also gain high spiritual capital!
Also, were you invisible in the orientation? The seat beside me always looked empty to me.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo, Film Club Coordi! You scared the shit out of me during Galaxy! We used to sleep together in both Photo and Film workshops, when did you become the artist I saw in Galaxy??
I had a lot of fun with you in Nainital and Rendezvous, but much more fun was bitching about <you know who>.
Also, remember how we fought during Galaxy? We planned to do so much when the Galaxy started but managed to just a part of it. But whatever it was, it was beautiful.
I hope that we keep vibing on Rajasthani words and daal baati churma forever!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Photo calling Films.
Chaabi nahi mil rahi bhai tumhare secys se pucho naaaa...
Over and out.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
<A head pat>
<chithi chithi robot music in the background>
Let's do one more summer together!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Report bana de na, kal submission he!
Syllabus bhi bata de merko quiz ka, aur class me kuch extra bataya tha kya??
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
It feels like I've done all the major courses and projects with you. I think I've called you every week to do some report, assignment, any calculation, or cheating for any course. We've done most of the labs together. For the ESO and UOP labs, we used to just gossip for 3 hours and do nothing. Remember how we started stealing the clay from the ESO lab just to pass those 3 long hours? And how we used to find different shapes on the surface of those metals which we had to draw? That was in a way just like finding shapes in the clouds. I was able to be my childish self again with you.
We have done so many stupid things in the labs together, like playing with the rubber gloves in the UOP lab, drilling in pencils and chalks in the TA lab. 
I wish to do such stupid things with you on a larger scale in the future. Let's level up this cool stuff we do next time we meet!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
My empty make-up palette, I want to fill you up with my concealer, contour and blush! Adopt me as your make-up stylist! You're the first girl of our batch I met. You were introduced to me as my sister right in the lift and I was so confused with what it meant and you were then again too calm and composed. Thanks for waking me up for all the morning PE classes. We had a big contribution in slowing down the speed of our PE group.
The dance you did on telepathia was lit, I want to experience it once again.
See you again on the trip!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Yo! You've been in my constantly through these 4 years, or should I say constantly with constant gapsüòÇ. Even when we talk after a long time, it feels like the relation between us is the same as it always has been. I think we started bonding when we started to study psychology together in CC, and then you introduced me to the NH91 manager! Ohhh that night was awkward! Most of the time we spent together was in B107/H1 ( cooking up 'Manurup') and look what fate brought to me during the initial quarantine. I wish that I could spend some more time with you during those last days at campus. Looking forward to a horror movie night!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Indra Ghale! That script was hilarious! Spending those few days in Film club making that short film, and watching those goats at Nankari was fun with you.
Indra Ghale will live forever on Facebook!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Hey partner! Let me be honest here, you did the pose better than me! The little moments we had together were beautiful, even the cycling together from HC to Hall-3 when I didn't know the routes. Let's do your birthday right someday!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Now that you're a dog lover, there is nothing that I don't like about you. You've been very organised, punctual and hard-working and I've always been motivated by seeing you being Soumya. Also, thanks for all the Kathi rolls you have fed us.
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Well, I've never seen the "wild" Sunamya, except the one in the play that we enacted. Lol, that was some dark humour! That play is one of my favourite memories of IITK. We've gossiped in so many classes but none of them was like ENG classes. That single course brought us so close to each other. I wanted to do another T. Ravi course with you guys. I got to know you so much better after that sem, I know that right now you're desperately waiting for the next episode of Riverdale, right?
Hope to see more of "wild" Sunamya!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Thanks for writing the death of Indra Ghale with me. We were almost done with shooting the whole God vs Satan story by ourselves in a day! Also, the Unmukt shoot would have been too frustrating without you.
I'm glad that we met and worked together in the film club. 
Let's sit together and write a great script once again!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo 1.5 spoons! Your acting skills are way better than Kangana Ranaut. Before these two months, we've only interacted in Priya's room and all I remember from those times is that you loved the phrase "piece of shit". I wish that I could have seen you picking up your phone from the toilet and drying it in rice.
I got to know you well just recently. You're a very cool and talented girl!
All the best for your future!
See you again on the trip!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Ravi is dead due to vagina!!!!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Yo, Nunnu! We started with doing DS together and now I'm doing all of my last sem courses with you. I don't smoke now, Tu bhi smoke karna chod de.
Also, keep inviting me to all of your family weddings!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
High 5?
This was probably the first thing we bonded on. I have always enjoyed wandering with the camera and you. The time in Bombay was probably the peak of our friendship till now. Watching the sunset quietly next to you, I think that we were talking with each other at that time without speaking anything. Do you think the same? That moment was a really special moment for me. All our trips and photo walks were memorable, especially the Banaras one. Although I used to get mad at you at times when you would ghost us during the club work. But those were temporary things. I hope that our friendship stays forever.
Also, we should go on a trip together soon!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text: Hey lab partner! Thanks for studying for all the labs ahead of it and then explaining them to me just in time. For a while, you were my go-to person whenever I faced any CHE crisis. Things got a little off route for a while but I believe that both of us are over it now. Looking forward to more crisis solving together with you!
author: Nupur  Mehra

text:
Prati!! Teach me your high-level Photoshop skills and then let's do the Art of PS again! 
I hope to listen to your famous "long stories" sometime.
author: Nupur  Mehra
